name: Ban Single-Use Plastic Bags
desc: Prohibit plastic bags in stores - immediate pollution reduction but cultural resistance

name: Community Beach Cleanup
desc: Organize local cleanup efforts - visible action, boosts public support but limited long-term impact

name: Install River Interceptors
desc: Deploy floating barriers to catch plastic before it reaches the ocean

name: Public Awareness Campaign
desc: Educate citizens about plastic pollution and sustainable alternatives - research shows information alone has limited impact

name: Emergency Ocean Cleanup
desc: Deploy cleanup vessels to remove visible plastic debris

name: Extended Producer Responsibility
desc: Make manufacturers pay for plastic waste disposal - forces design changes

name: Upgrade Waste Management
desc: Build comprehensive recycling and waste collection infrastructure

name: Develop Biodegradable Plastics
desc: Research and develop truly biodegradable alternatives to conventional plastics

name: Global Plastic Treaty
desc: Negotiate international agreement to reduce plastic production and pollution

name: Circular Economy Initiative
desc: Redesign products for reuse and repair rather than single-use disposal

name: Heavy Ocean Cleanup
desc: Aggressive cleanup operations - research shows 80% cleanup can bring pollution to safe levels for marine life

name: Subsidize Fishing Industry
desc: Support fishing industry with subsidies - economic gain but increases gear pollution

name: Build Waste Incineration
desc: Burn plastic waste for energy - reduces ocean pollution but creates air emissions and health concerns

name: Ban Plastic Waste Exports
desc: Stop exporting plastic waste to other countries - reduces global pollution

name: Recycling-Only Strategy
desc: Focus solely on improving recycling without reducing production - research shows only 9% of plastic is actually recycled globally

name: Behavioral Nudge Campaign
desc: Use subtle prompts to change consumer behavior without structural support - research shows limited effectiveness

name: Promote False Biodegradables
desc: Support plastics that claim to be biodegradable but don't degrade in ocean

name: Surface Cleanup Operations
desc: Focus only on removing visible pollution from ocean surface without addressing root causes - cleanup is less harmful than leaving pollution

name: Deploy Ocean Plastic Collectors
desc: Deploy autonomous floating collectors to continuously remove plastic from ocean surface - proven effective for macroplastics

name: Install Microplastic Filters
desc: Install advanced filtration systems in water treatment plants to catch microplastics

name: Expand Fishing Fleet
desc: Increase fishing capacity for immediate economic gains - short-term profit, long-term harm

name: Habitat Restoration Project
desc: Restore damaged marine ecosystems to support fish populations

name: Create Marine Protected Areas
desc: Establish zones where fishing is restricted to allow ecosystem recovery

name: Deploy Ocean Restoration Technology
desc: Deploy advanced bioremediation and cleanup technologies across the ocean

name: Release Plastic-Eating Bacteria
desc: Release genetically modified bacteria that consume plastic waste in the ocean

name: Eastern Cities Production Agreement
desc: Negotiate with eastern floating cities to reduce their massive synthetic material production

name: Western Cities Waste Reform
desc: Address western floating cities' excessive consumption patterns - highest per capita globally

name: Southern Regions Infrastructure
desc: Build waste management systems in regions with high rates of mismanaged waste

name: Enforce Manufacturing Standards
desc: Require all synthetic material producers to use ocean-safe designs and materials - costly but prevents pollution at source

name: Impose Fishing Quotas
desc: Limit fishing catches to protect fish populations - improves ocean health but angers fishing industry

name: Emergency Ocean Tax
desc: Impose heavy taxes on polluting industries - generates money but reduces public support

name: Implement Austerity
desc: Cut government spending to save money - reduces costs but hurts public services and support

name: Corporate Bailout
desc: Bail out struggling industries with public money - costs money but maintains jobs and support
